description: MSCI, which compiles the index, says it will work with regulators to assure that China’s markets are prepared for the move.
title: Global Index May Add Chinese Stocks, Fueling Investment
title_page: Global Index May Add Chinese Stocks, Fueling Investment - The New York Times
text:
HONG KONG — Chinese stocks do not really need an extra boost. They have tripled in value over the last year to nearly $10 trillion — overtaking Japan, Hong Kong and Britain and coming in second only to the United States.
But new overseas money may soon pour into the mainland, providing more fuel to the country’s already racing markets.
On Tuesday, MSCI, a company that compiles indexes widely tracked by money managers around the world, said it could soon add China’s domestic shares to its benchmarks.
Mutual funds and other global investments totaling about $1.5 trillion are pegged to MSCI’s emerging-markets index. A decision to include domestic Chinese stocks, or so-called A-shares, in the index means that billions of dollars will be channeled into mainland markets.
